physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 67-year-old man with a palpable abdominal mass; CT scan showed a 12-cm lesion from the gastric wall; esophagogastroduodenoscopy revealed a 2-cm gastric antral polyp and subcentimetric duodenal pseudopolyps.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient underwent partial gastrectomy, during which an 8-cm right-colonic polyp was also observed and resected. Pathology revealed two gastric GISTs (110 mm and 23 mm), three gastric inflammatory fibroid polyps (19 mm, 14 mm, and 10 mm), and three fibrous tumors (18 mm, 8 mm, and 8 mm). At 48 months follow-up imaging showed no recurrence.
